examples.toki-pona: a! akesi suli li wile moku mi!
examples.english: Ahh! The dinosaur wants to eat me!

examples.toki-pona: akesi li pana e telo moli.
tenpo pini la jan ali li alasa e soweli e kili.
examples.english: In the past, everybody hunted buffalo and fruit.

examples.toki-pona: jan alasa pona li wawa li sona pona e ma ona li pona tawa meli mute
examples.english: A good hunter is strong, knows his land well, and is liked by many women.

examples.toki-pona: mani pi ma ante li pona tawa mi.
examples.english: I like the currency of other nations.

examples.toki-pona: pipi ni li ike tawa mi. pipi ante li pona tawa mi.
examples.english: I don't like this insect, I like other insects.

examples.toki-pona: ona anu mi li pona tawa sina?
examples.english: Do you like him or me?

examples.toki-pona: mi moku e moku e telo
mi en sina li jan pona.
mi en sina li jan pona.
mi wile kama jo e ijo.
tenpo pini la mi moku e ijo. tenpo ni la mi wile pana e ko jaki.
examples.english: I ate something, and now I need to defecate.

meanings: to have a negative effect upon

examples.toki-pona: ike li pona ala tawa mi.

meanings: thing used for a specific purpose

examples.toki-pona: mi pona e ilo kepeken mi luka
examples.english: I fixed the tool using my hands.

examples.toki-pona: mi wile jaki e ma tomo.
examples.english: I want to pollute the city.

examples.toki-pona: jan ali li wile tawa musi.
sina wile kama jo mani tan tomo mani
examples.english: You want to get some money from the bank.

examples.toki-pona: sina kalama. ni li pona tawa mi.

meanings: pursue actions to arrive to (a certain state)

examples.toki-pona: meli mi li ken moku e telo nasa!

meanings: (between adverb or phrase of context and sentence)
(between any subject except mi and sina and its verb; also used to introduce a new verb for the same subject)
very thin, floppy thing, such as string, rope, hair, thread, cord and chain
flat and bendable thing, such as paper, card or a ticket
long, mostly hard object, e.g. rod, stick, branch
relating to the official Toki Pona book
relating to the official and original grammar of Toki Pona.
to use Toki Pona following the official and original grammar
to read the Toki Pona book

examples.english: I read the official Toki Pona book in the restroom.

meanings: indoor constructed space, e.g. house, home, room, building
